summary: This document consists of Bureau of Prisons count sheets and inmate rosters from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 8, 2019. It records official inmate counts by housing unit and includes a roster showing two inmates assigned to a hospital or suicide watch unit.

persons.name: Gama-Pineda
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 85918-054, assigned to a hospital or suicide watch unit (HOSP) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 8, 2019.

persons.name: Torres
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 85621-054, assigned to a hospital or suicide watch unit (HOSP) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 8, 2019.

events.title: Daily inmate count at MCC New York
events.description: Routine official inmate count conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, recording a total census of 759 inmates across various housing units.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The document is dated August 8, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
It shows a total inmate census of 759 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Two inmates, Gama-Pineda and Torres, are listed on a roster assigned to a hospital or suicide watch unit (HOSP).
The document is part of routine prison administrative records for inmate counts and assignments.
No direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein is found in this specific extract, though the date and location are significant to the case timeline.
